en.header: True or false? There is nothing to learn from junior employees, but there is a lot to teach them.
en.klf: It is certainly your responsibility to help juniors learn. But learning should be a two-way street: all employees possess useful knowledge, even ‘ignorant’ ones. It is your job to find out what it is, and you should be prepared to be managed upwards.
en.tips: In a ‘reverse mentoring’ situation, a younger employee is the mentor of an older member of the company. This younger employee has less overall experience, but possesses more knowledge in a particular field, such as digital technologies for example.

fr.header: Vrai ou faux ? Il n'y a rien à apprendre des employés débutants, mais il y a beaucoup à leur enseigner.
fr.klf: Il est de votre responsabilité d'aider les juniors à apprendre. Mais l’apprentissage doit aller dans les deux sens : tous les employés possèdent des connaissances utiles, même les « ignorants ». C'est à vous de trouver quelles sont-elles, et vous devez être prêt à être géré vers le haut.
fr.tips: Dans une situation de « reverse mentoring », un jeune employé est le mentor d’un membre plus âgé de la société. Ce jeune employé a moins d'expérience globale mais possède plus de connaissances dans un domaine particulier, tel que les technologies numériques, par exemple.

de.klf: It is certainly your responsibility to help juniors learn. But learning should be a two-way street: all employees possess useful knowledge, even ‘ignorant’ ones. It is your job to find out what it is, and you should be prepared to be managed upwards.
de.tips: In a ‘reverse mentoring’ situation, a younger employee is the mentor of an older member of the company. This younger employee has less overall experience, but possesses more knowledge in a particular field, such as digital technologies for example.
